AirMonitorIngest 0.3.7
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Download and aggregate multiple hourly data files from AirNow

Source: R/airnow_getHourlyData.R
airnow_getHourlyData.Rd

This function downloads, parses and combines hourly data files from baseUrl.

Parameters included in AirNow data include at least the following list:

  1. BARPR

  2. BC

  3. CO

  4. NO

  5. NO2

  6. NO2Y

  7. NO2X

  8. NOX

  9. NOOY

  10. OC

  11. OZONE

  12. PM10

  13. PM2.5

  14. PRECIP

  15. RHUM

  16. SO2

  17. SRAD

  18. TEMP

  19. UV-AETH

  20. WD

  21. WS

Passing a vector of one ore more of the above names as the parameters argument will cause the resulting tibble to be filtered to contain only records for those parameters.

Datetimes can be anything that is understood by MazamaCoreUtils::parseDatetime(). For non-POSIXct values, the recommended format is "YYYY-mm-dd HH:00:00" or just "YYYYmmddhh".

airnow_getHourlyData(
  parameterName = c("PM2.5"),
  starttime = NULL,
  endtime = NULL,
  timezone = "UTC",
  baseUrl = "https://files.airnowtech.org/airnow",
  verbose = FALSE
)

Arguments

parameterName

One or more EPA AQS criteria parameter names.
starttime

Desired start datetime (ISO 8601).
endtime

Desired end datetime (ISO 8601).
timezone

Olson timezone used to interpret dates (required).
baseUrl

Base URL for archived hourly data.
verbose

Logical flag controlling detailed progress statements.

Value

Tibble of AirNow hourly data.

Note

Hourly data are available from AirNow starting on 2014-01-01.

Data from locations whose timezones have a fractional offset from UTC are removed as the mts_monitor data model only supports data reported on hour boundaries. As of 2019-06-26, fractional offsets only applies to US Department of State monitors in Myanmar, Sri Lanka, India and Nepal.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
# Fail gracefully if any resources are not available
try({

library(AirMonitorIngest)

tbl <-
  airnow_getHourlyData(
    parameterName = "PM2.5",
    starttime = 2021101200,
    endtime = 2021101204,
    timezone = "America/Los_Angeles",
    verbose = TRUE
   )

}, silent = FALSE)
}
